job_title: Software Engineer - Platform Test - Systems Test Engineering
job_description: <h2><br /><b>Company:</b></h2>Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><h2><b>Job Area:</b></h2>Engineering Group, Engineering Group &gt; Systems Test Engineering<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><u><b>General Summary:</b></u></p><p>Drive innovation and reliability for Snapdragon SoC-based platforms at scale. As part of the Platform Test team, Youâ€™ll focus on <b>test content development</b>, <b>automation</b>, and <b>validation</b> of critical platform components such as <b>CPU, Kernel, Performance, CI/CD pipelines, and Linux distributions</b>. This role emphasizes <b>execution excellence</b>, <b>problem-solving</b>, and <b>independent ownership</b> of tasks with minimal guidance.</p><p></p><p><b>Skills</b></p><ul><li>Proficient in <b>Python</b> and <b>Shell/Bash</b> scripting; familiarity with <b>Java</b> or <b>C/C&#43;&#43;</b> is a plus.</li><li>Basic understanding of <b>Linux distributions</b> (Ubuntu, Redhat, CentOS) and OS fundamentals (memory, scheduling, storage, virtualization).</li><li>Exposure to <b>CI/CD workflows</b>, source code management, and test automation tools.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills with ability to work independently and manage time effectively.</li><li>Willingness to learn performance benchmarking and optimization techniques.</li><li>Experience with real-world deployment scenarios is desirable; open-source contributions are a bonus.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Key Responsibilities</b></p><p>As an <b>Engineer</b>, you will:</p><ul><li>Develop and maintain <b>automated test scripts</b> and integrate them into CI/CD workflows.</li><li>Execute test plans and validate platform components for performance, stability, and compliance.</li><li>Enhance existing test frameworks and contribute to automation improvements.</li><li>Collaborate with development teams to ensure testability and resolve issues quickly.</li><li>Automate industry-standard benchmarks and assist in incorporating OEM requirements.</li><li>Troubleshoot technical challenges and deliver solutions with a focus on efficiency.</li></ul><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><u><b>Minimum Qualifications:</b></u></p>â€¢ Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Education Preferred Qualifications</b></p><ul><li>Bachelorâ€™s degree in engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and <b>1&#43; years</b> of Software Engineering or related work experience.</li><li>Masterâ€™s degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, and <b>1&#43; years</b> of Software Engineering or related work experience.</li><li>Strong programming foundation in <b>Python</b> and scripting languages.</li></ul><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer. job_title: Software Engineer Full Stack & Application Development 1
job_description: <p>Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today but could open in the near future. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.</p><p></p><p></p><div><div><p><span><span>Applications are accepted until further notice. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span> </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span><span>Meet the Team</span></span><span> </span></b></p></div><div><p><span><span>Join Cisco's innovative engineering community, where<span> </span></span><span>you'll</span><span><span> </span>have the opportunity to collaborate with teams across Cisco IT, CPX (Customer & Partner Experience), Supply Chain, and Workplace Technology.<span> </span></span><span>You'll</span><span><span> </span>work alongside hardworking engineers, designers, and product managers who bring ideas to life and transform how the world connects, communicates, and collaborates. Our teams value creativity, continuous learning, and a culture of inclusion as we build the next generation of industry-leading products and platforms!</span></span><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b><span><span>Your Impact</span></span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><p><span><span>As a Software Engineer at Cisco, you will design and build software solutions that power Cisco's products and platforms. You will work end-to-end on everything from APIs and backend services to user interfaces and distributed systems.<span> </span></span><span>You'll</span><span><span> </span>solve real-world problems, ship impactful features, and help shape the future of connectivity and technology.</span></span><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b><span><span>Minimum Qualifications</span></span><span> </span></b></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Completion within the past 3 years, or current enrollment with expected completion within 12 months, of a certification or relevant degree program (e.g., Associate's, Apprenticeship, Boot Camp, or Certification in a specialized program + 1 year of relevant experience, High School Diploma + 2 years of relevant experience) or Bachelor's + 0 years of relevant experience.</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Proficiency</span><span><span> </span>in at least one backend language (Python, C++, or Java) and familiarity with JavaScript/TypeScript for frontend development</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Experience with API development (REST,<span> </span></span><span>GraphQL</span><span>, or<span> </span></span><span>gRPC</span><span>)</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Understanding of data structures, object-oriented programming, and SQL/NoSQL databases</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP, or Cisco Cloud)</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p></p><p><b><span><span>Preferred Qualifications</span></span><span> </span></b></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Experience with Docker or Kubernetes (containerization/orchestration)</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation)</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Exposure to CI/CD tools (GitHub Actions, Jenkins,<span> </span></span><span>CircleCI</span><span>)</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Experience with monitoring platforms (Grafana, Prometheus, Splunk)</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Knowledge of UI frameworks (React, Angular, Vue) for full-stack pathways</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><p></p><h1>Why Cisco? </h1><p>At Cisco, weâ€™re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era â€“ and beyond. Weâ€™ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.</p><p>Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and youâ€™ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere. </p><p>We are Cisco, and our power starts with you. </p><p></p><h1>Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S. and/or Canada:</h1><p></p><p>Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location, market conditions, job-related skillset, experience, qualifications, education, certifications, and/or training. The full salary range for certain locations is listed below. For locations not listed below, the recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.</p><p></p><p>U.S. employees are offered benefits, subject to Ciscoâ€™s plan eligibility rules, which include medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, paid parental leave, short and long-term disability coverage, and basic life insurance. Please see the Cisco careers site to discover more benefits and perks. Employees may be eligible to receive grants of Cisco restricted stock units, which vest following continued employment with Cisco for defined periods of time.</p><p></p><p>U.S. employees are eligible for paid time away as described below, subject to Ciscoâ€™s policies:</p><ul><li><p>10 paid holidays per full calendar year, plus 1 floating holiday for non-exempt employees</p></li><li><p>1 paid day off for employeeâ€™s birthday, paid year-end holiday shutdown, and 4 paid days off for personal wellness determined by Cisco</p></li><li><p>Non-exempt employees** receive 16 days of paid vacation time per full calendar year, accrued at rate of 4.92 hours per pay period for full-time employees</p></li><li><p>Exempt employees participate in Ciscoâ€™s flexible vacation time off program, which has no defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use (subject to availability and some business limitations)</p></li><li><p>80 hours of sick time off provided on hire date and each January 1st thereafter, and up to 80 hours of unused sick time carried forward from one calendar year to the next</p></li><li><p>Additional paid time away may be requested to deal with critical or emergency issues for family members</p></li><li><p>Optional 10 paid days per full calendar year to volunteer</p></li></ul><p></p><p>For non-sales roles, employees are also eligible to earn annual bonuses subject to Ciscoâ€™s policies.</p><p></p><p>Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components, subject to the applicable Cisco plan. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows:</p><ul><li><p>.75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;</p></li><li><p>1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%;</p></li><li><p>1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and</p></li><li><p>Once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.</p></li></ul><p></p><p>For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay 0% up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.</p><p></p><p>The applicable full salary ranges for this position, by specific state, are listed below:</p><p></p><p>New York City Metro Area:</p>$104,700.00 - $153,000.00<p>Non-Metro New York state & Washington state: </p>$92,100.00 - $136,000.00<p>* For quota-based sales roles on Ciscoâ€™s sales plan, the ranges provided in this posting include base pay and sales target incentive compensation combined.</p><p>** Employees in Illinois, whether exempt or non-exempt, will participate in a unique time off program to meet local requirements.</p>
